NEW DELHI: Sitting comfortably at the third spot in the IPL 2024 standings with six points, Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) have clinched three victories, two of which were secured on their home ground.Their next challenge lies in defeating a struggling Delhi Capitals , currently at the bottom of the table with just one win out of five matches. Despite their solid performance, LSG face concerns in their pace department, with young sensation Mayank Yadav possibly sidelined due to an abdominal issue for the upcoming match.However, even in the absence of key players like Mayank and Mohsin Khan, LSG displayed resilience in their recent encounter against Gujarat Titans, with Yash Thakur's superb bowling securing victory. In the spin department, Krunal Pandya and Ravi Bishnoi have been standout performers. Although skipper KL Rahul's batting form has been inconsistent, his leadership remains crucial. Star batters Quinton de Kock and Nicholas Pooran have been in fine touch, while Ayush Badoni and Devdutt Padikkal are yet to shine.Meanwhile, Delhi Capitals are grappling with injuries to key players like Mitchell Marsh and Kuldeep Yadav, further complicating their campaign. Despite relying on pacers Khaleel Ahmed and Ishant Sharma, DC's bowling lineup has struggled for consistency, compounded by Anrich Nortje's ongoing rustiness post-injury.Over the last two seasons, Lucknow Super Giants and Delhi Capitals clashed three times, with LSG boasting an unblemished record against DC, winning all three encounters. The head-to-head tally stands at 3-0 in favor of LSG, showcasing their dominance over DC in recent matchups.Last season, LSG secured a significant victory against Delhi Capitals, largely credited to Mark Wood's pivotal performance for Rahul's squad. Despite Warner and Shaw's explosive start, reaching 40/0 in just four overs, Wood's consecutive breakthroughs disrupted Delhi's momentum.With efforts from Warner to stabilize going in vain, Lucknow's imposing target of 193 remained insurmountable. Kyle Mayers and Nicholas Pooran's contributions were instrumental in propelling Lucknow to a formidable total in the first innings.In the last five matches at Lucknow's Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium, the chasing team has emerged victorious each time. This trend indicates that the toss-winning captain in the upcoming match will likely opt to field first. In IPL 2024, the stadium has hosted only two matches, both won by LSG with a margin of over 20 runs.The Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow boasts two distinct types of pitches: red soil and black soil pitches. These varying soil compositions offer diverse playing conditions, influencing the behavior of the ball and the strategies employed by players. Teams need to adapt their game plans accordingly, making the stadium a unique and challenging venue for cricket matches.In Lucknow's Ekana Cricket Stadium, slow bowlers often find favour due to the pitches' tendency to offer low and slow deliveries. Players like Ravi Bishnoi and Kuldeep Yadav are expected to thrive in such conditions. However, teams batting first typically hold the advantage, suggesting that setting a target may be key to securing victory at the venue.Quinton de Kock, KL Rahul (c) (wk), Deepak Hooda/Devdutt Padikkal, Marcus Stoinis, Nicholas Pooran, Krunal Pandya, Ayush Badoni, Ravi Bishnoi, Naveen-ul-Haq, Yash Thakur, Yudhvir Singh.Prithvi Shaw, David Warner , Rishabh Pant (c) (wk), Abishek Porel, Tristan Stubbs, Axar Patel, Kumar Kushagra, Kuldeep Yadav, Khaleel Ahmed, Mukesh Kumar, Anrich Nortje.Wicketkeepers: Quinton de Kock, KL Rahul, Nicholas Pooran, Rishabh PantBatters: Prithvi Shaw, David WarnerAll-rounders: Axar Patel, Marcus StoinisBowlers: Ravi Bishnoi, Naveen-ul-Haq, Anrich NortjeCaptain: David WarnerVice-captain: Axar PatelAs the captain of the team, Rahul's leadership and batting prowess will be instrumental in guiding LSG to victory against DC. Known for his consistency and ability to anchor the innings, Rahul's performance will play a crucial role in setting up a competitive total or chasing down the opposition's score. The Indian international has scored 126 runs in four matches.Having amassed 126 runs in four matches, Nicholas Pooran emerges as a pivotal player for LSG. Pooran's explosive batting style and ability to score quick runs make him a formidable force in the middle order. With his capability to change the course of the game with aggressive strokes, Pooran's performance will be crucial in setting up a challenging total or accelerating the run rate during crucial phases of the match.Warner's vast experience, formidable batting technique, and knack for scoring big runs make him a vital asset at the top of the order. Partnering with Prithvi Shaw, he could anchor the innings while also accelerating the scoring rate when needed. Moreover, Warner's leadership qualities and strategic insights on the field add depth to DC's gameplay, making him a pivotal figure in their quest for victory against LSG.

NEW DELHI: Yuzvendra Chahal of the Rajasthan Royals stands atop the Purple Cap leaderboard, claiming 11 wickets in 6 innings. His exceptional spin bowling has played a pivotal role in Rajasthan's campaign, highlighting the intense competition among bowlers vying for the prestigious Purple Cap. Trailing closely behind is Jasprit Bumrah, who surged to second place following his remarkable 5-wicket haul against RCB, accumulating 10 wickets in 5 innings. (Here's a list of updated Purple Cap list) In a crucial encounter, Match 27, Kagiso Rabada's pivotal dismissals of Yashasvi Jaiswal and RR's skipper Sanju Samson bolstered PBKS' pressure on Rajasthan. Despite Rabada's efforts, Shimron Hetmyer's explosive knock of 27 off 10 balls propelled RR to victory, consequently elevating him to the third position in the rankings.CSK's Mustafizur Rahman closely trails with 9 wickets in four innings, showcasing his consistency and skill in pivotal moments. Additionally, Khaleel Ahmed's significant contributions, including dismissing prominent batters like de Kock and Padikkal, secured him the fourth spot with 9 wickets in 6 innings, emphasizing his ability to perform under pressure.Overall, the race for the Purple Cap in IPL 2024 is intense, with standout performances from bowlers like Chahal, Bumrah, Rabada, Rahman, and Ahmed, each making significant contributions to their respective teams' campaigns.

Article Title: Philadelphia Flyers secure crucial win against New Jersey Devils
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Travis Konecny 's NHL-leading sixth short-handed goal proved to be the difference-maker as the Philadelphia Flyers edged past the visiting New Jersey Devils with a 1-0 victory on Saturday, keeping their playoff hopes alive.With the win, the Flyers (38-32-11, 87 points) secured their second consecutive victory after enduring an eight-game losing streak where they were outscored 42-18.This marked their first back-to-back wins since February 6-12, when they enjoyed a four-game winning streak.Philadelphia now sits one point ahead of the Pittsburgh Penguins for the second wild-card spot in the Eastern Conference, enhancing their postseason chances.Konecny's milestone short-handed goal, his 16th of the season, came midway through the second period, marking his 400th career NHL point. His performance has been instrumental in the Flyers' recent successes, as he also contributed a goal and an assist in Thursday's 4-1 victory over the New York Rangers.In goal, Samuel Ersson stood tall for the Flyers, turning away all 20 shots he faced to secure his fourth shutout of the season and fifth of his career. Ersson's stellar performance was complemented by his teammates, who blocked 22 shots from the Devils throughout the game.Despite New Jersey's efforts, including goaltender Kappo Kahkonen 's 20 saves, the Devils (38-38-5, 81 points) couldn't generate enough offense to overcome the Flyers' defense. This loss marks their second in the last eight games, and they were shut out for the fourth time this season after scoring 12 goals in their previous three matchups against Philadelphia.The game's lone goal came with just over nine minutes left in the second period when Konecny capitalized on a breakaway opportunity, receiving a pass from Nick Seeler and lifting a shot from the high slot over Kahkonen's blocker.Overall, it was a hard-fought victory for the Flyers, keeping their postseason aspirations alive as they enter the final stretch of the regular season.
Article Summary: Philadelphia Flyers beat New Jersey Devils 1-0. Travis Konecny scored his sixth short-handed goal of the season. Samuel Ersson turned away all 20 shots he faced to secure the shutout. The win is Philadelphia's second consecutive after an eight-game losing streak.

Article Title: Dallas Stars clinch central division title with victory over Seattle Kraken
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: The Dallas Stars secured their first Central Division title since 2016 with a solid 3-1 victory over the Seattle Kraken . Miro Heiskanen led the charge with a goal and two assists, while Jason Robertson contributed a goal and an assist as well.Craig Smith also found the back of the net for the Stars, who improved their record to 51-21-9, totaling 111 points for the season.Despite having an opportunity to clinch the Western Conference regular-season crown, the Stars fell just short as the Vancouver Canucks won their game.In the victory, goaltender Jake Oettinger made 26 saves, preserving the win for Dallas and keeping them one point behind the New York Rangers for the top spot in the NHL standings .Dallas capitalized on scoring opportunities late in the first two periods, with goals from Smith and Robertson. Heiskanen sealed the win with a goal in the third period, extending the Stars' lead to 3-0.Although the Kraken managed to spoil Oettinger's shutout bid with a goal from Kailer Yamamoto in the third period, it wasn't enough to mount a comeback against the Stars' strong performance.In other news, the Kraken made roster moves by reassigning Shane Wright, Ryan Winterton, and Logan Morrison to Coachella Valley of the AHL to prepare for the Calder Cup playoffs. Wright, the fourth overall pick in the 2022 draft, was nearing the threshold to trigger his entry-level contract.

Article Title: Watch - 'And then you die and...': Virat Kohli on sticking to RCB despite multiple offers
Article Text:
|

|

NEW DELHI: Virat Kohli and Royal Challengers Bengaluru are synonymous to each other in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Virat has played for RCB since IPL 's inaugural season in 2008 and stuck to it.Virat has been the captain of RCB for several seasons, bringing his aggressive and passionate style of leadership to the team. Under his captaincy, RCB has seen both highs and lows, including reaching the IPL finals in 2016.But Kohli has stuck with the team even though RCB still haven't won the IPL trophy.In a viral video, Kohli explains in a podcast what RCB means to him and why he has not joined any other team.The host asks, "Virat I know you love RCB just as much as RCB loves you. Even for a moment, for a second, while playing this IPL, have you ever wondered is the grass greener on the other side?"Virat answers, "To be very honest I have thought about it, yes I won't shy away from it and I've been approached many times as well to come into the auction somehow, put my name in there and stuff. And then I thought about it I was like at the end of the day everyone has X number of years they live right and then you die and then life moves on. And there would have been many great people who want trophies and this that blah blah blah but no one addresses you in the room like "Oh he's an IPL champion" or "he's a World Cup champion"."And it's like if you're a good person, people like you and if you're a bad guy, they stay away from you and eventually that's what life is all about so for me the understanding that the loyalty with RCB is like how I follow my life is far greater for me than the fact that yes five people in the room would say, "Oh finally you've won the IPL with whoever XYZ and yeah you feel good for five minutes but then the sixth minute you could be miserable with some other issue in life, so it is not the end of the world for me," Kohli adds.Kohli goes on to say, "What this franchise (RCB) has given me in terms of opportunity in the first three years and believed in me, that is the most special thing because as I said there were many teams who had the opportunity but they didn't back me, they didn't believe in me so now when I'm successful and I should fall to the opinion of people saying "but the IPL". This was the case with me till 2018 England tour happened. For four years of my life I was doing well everywhere in the world, the only thing was but "England". So there's always going to be buts, you literally can't live your life like that and I just carry on my own thing and I actually honestly don't even bother about a third person beyond myself, Anushka discussing things and just being true to ourselves. And that's it for me, nothing else and no one else's opinion matters at all."Overall, Virat Kohli's journey with RCB has been marked by exceptional batting displays, leadership challenges, and a strong connection with the team's fan base, making him a central figure in the franchise's history.Despite Kohli's individual brilliance, RCB has often struggled to clinch the IPL title. They have reached the playoffs on multiple occasions but have faced challenges in converting those opportunities into championships.Unlike many other players who have switched teams over the years, Kohli has remained loyal to RCB throughout his IPL career. His commitment to the franchise has made him a beloved figure among RCB fans.Kohli's personal achievements, including multiple centuries and accolades like the Orange Cap , highlight his impact on the team.
Article Summary: Virat Kohli has played for Royal Challengers Bengaluru since IPL's inaugural season in 2008. He has been the captain of RCB for several seasons, bringing his aggressive and passionate style of leadership to the team. Kohli explains in a viral video what RCB means to him and why he has not joined any other team.

Article Title: Hardik Pandya: 'If he is not bowling, does Hardik Pandya make the T20 World Cup squad?'
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Renowned cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle has sparked debate over the inclusion of India all-rounder Hardik Pandya in the squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in June.Bhogle's comments come in light of Pandya's recent struggles with fitness and his limited bowling contribution in the IPL 2024 season.Pandya, who captains the Mumbai Indians in this year's IPL, made a comeback to cricket after a five-month hiatus due to an ankle injury sustained during the ODI World Cup last year.While Pandya initially bowled a few overs in his return matches, his bowling workload has been sporadic, raising doubts over his ability to contribute as an all-rounder.Bhogle pointed out Pandya's waning power-hitting skills and questioned whether he still merits a place in the T20 World Cup squad solely as a batsman if he is unable to bowl consistently."If Hardik is not bowling, does Hardik make the T20 World Cup squad?" Bhogle questioned, while speaking on Cricbuzz. "Is he among the top six batters in India if he is not bowling? I’m not totally convinced of that because if he is not bowling and he is not finishing as powerfully, he needs to bat up, where all the competition is."Bhogle emphasized the importance of Pandya's all-round abilities in balancing India's playing XI, particularly in the absence of regular bowling options among the top-order batsmen.Pandya's ability to bowl four overs provides a crucial additional bowling option for the team and ensures the presence of at least two all-rounders, with Ravindra Jadeja also in contention.However, with Pandya's fitness and bowling form under scrutiny, his selection for the T20 World Cup could hinge on his ability to regain full fitness and contribute effectively with both bat and ball.
Article Summary: Renowned cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle questions inclusion of all-rounder Hardik Pandya in India's T20 World Cup squad. Bhogle points out Pandya's waning power-hitting skills and questioned whether he still merits a place in the squad solely as a batsman.

Article Title: 'Josh mein hosh nahi khona....' Childhood coach's mantra for Kuldeep Yadav
Article Text:
(With IANS inputs)

NEW DELHI: Kuldeep Yadav 's childhood coach Kapil Dev Pandey disclosed on Sunday that he had advised the Indian spinner against hastening his return to the field to "impress anyone," emphasizing the importance of being "100% fit" before taking the ground for Delhi Capitals in the 2024 Indian Premier League (IPL).Following a three-match absence due to a groin injury, Kuldeep made his comeback for Delhi Capitals, capturing three crucial wickets while conceding just 20 runs against Lucknow Super Giants.His stellar performance was instrumental in Delhi's crucial victory."Yes, I spoke to him, I asked him why he was not playing the match and he said that he was injured. I said don't play until you are fit, this was my advice. Often players become emotional in the pursuit of a match or in the pursuit of taking the franchise higher. Josh mein hosh nahi khona... So, I said to play only when you are fit."Because at this time Kuldeep cannot play just for himself or for any franchise... It is more important to play for the country. That's why I told him you should play only when you are fit, he said 'my team is losing, so it is very important for me to play'. So, he played that match in which he bowled brilliantly," Kapil Dev Pandey told IANS.The coach added that with the T20 World Cup in mind, Kuldeep incorporated some changes, including adding variations, to his bowling repertoire."Injuries keep happening in the long process. But Kuldeep is in his top form. When the last World Cup ended, I told him that there are Test matches so keep your preparation well. It is difficult to come to a Test after the ODI... as soon as the Test matches ended, the IPL started. I told him to use his brain well to read the batter. Bowl according to batsman. I advised him to reduce the flight of your ball and keep it on the spot."You must have seen the googly he bowled to Nicholas Pooran . I told him to go for more googlies than Chinaman," he said.Kapil Dev Pandey also said that Kuldeep has good competition from Yuzvendra Chahal. "Other players like Yuzvendra Chahal are also doing well. It is not that Kuldeep does not have competition but he is in better form than everyone else at the moment.""Kuldeep is successful on Asian wickets but is even more successful on foreign soil. He took wickets in Australia; he was the best bowler in England and had the best bowling in the West Indies. He likes wickets which offer little bounce or are fast. It will become even more difficult to understand Kuldeep," said the coach.
Article Summary: Kuldeep Yadav's childhood coach Kapil Dev Pandey says he had advised the Indian spinner against hastening his return to the field to "impress anyone" Pandey emphasized the importance of being "100% fit" before taking the ground for Delhi Capitals in the 2024 Indian Premier League.

Article Title: 'India need Hardik Pandya to win T20 World Cup': Former England captain criticizes treatment of MI skipper by Wankhede crowd
Article Text: NEW DELHI: As Mumbai Indians prepare for their third consecutive home match in IPL 2024 , the focus shifts to the behavior of spectators at the iconic Wankhede Stadium , following scathing remarks from former England captain Michael Vaughan regarding the treatment of MI skipper Hardik Pandya by the home crowd.Vaughan's comments came during an appearance on The Ranveer Show on YouTube, where he expressed bewilderment at the behavior of Indian fans towards Pandya.IPL 2024: POINTS TABLE Despite a momentary respite during a previous match against Delhi Capitals, where Pandya was spared from booing due to the presence of children from various NGOs, Vaughan highlighted the hostility Pandya faced in other games, notably at the Wankhede Stadium."I don't understand booing. I kind of got it in the first game in Gujarat, because he played for them for two years and did not do well as a captain. But then when he went to Hyderabad, I was like, 'What's going on.' Then when he came back to Wankhede, his own home support was booing him. I did not understand that," Vaughan remarked.Acknowledging initial booing in Gujarat attributed to Pandya's stint with the Gujarat Titans, Vaughan expressed shock at the treatment Pandya received in subsequent matches, particularly at his home ground.In light of the upcoming T20 World Cup , Vaughan stressed the pivotal role Pandya plays in India's quest for success in the tournament scheduled to begin in June."What Indian cricket fans need to understand is that Mumbai Indians are Indian fans and for India to win the T20 World Cup, they need Hardik Pandya. They need him to play well. So somehow, over the next few weeks, they need him to get that confidence level right up to the top level, because with India having Hardik flying, they have a great chance in lifting that trophy,” Vaughan asserted.Vaughan's statement serves as a call to action for Indian cricket fans, urging them to support and uplift Pandya's spirit and confidence in the coming weeks of the competition. Article Summary: Former England captain Michael Vaughan expresses bewilderment at treatment of Hardik Pandya by Indian fans. Pandya has been booed by the home crowd at the Wankhede Stadium. Vaughan stressed the pivotal role Pandya plays in India's quest for success in the upcoming T20 World Cup.

Article Summary: MS Dhoni will have an opportunity to become the second cricketer after Suresh Raina to score 5000 runs in T20s for the Chennai Super Kings. If he manages to score at least four runs during match No. 29 of IPL 2024, he will join his former teammate Raina in the elite 5000-run club.

Quinton De Kock and Rahul aim for batting resurgence, supported by a formidable lineup including Marcus Stoinis and Nicholas Pooran. With spinners Ravi Bishnoi and Krunal Pandya in their arsenal, LSG poses a challenge for KKR's batters.Also read: IPL Today Match LSG vs KKR : Kolkata Knight Riders vs Lucknow Super Giants, IPL 2024, Match 28th: April 14 (Sunday): Eden Gardens, Kolkata: 3:30 PM (IST): Live stream/telecast on Jio Cinema and Star Sports Network
Article Summary: Two-time IPL champions Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) will seek home advantage as they strive to regain momentum against a weakened Lucknow Super Giants LSG. Both teams currently stand level in the points table, with three wins each and losses in their recent outings.

Article Title: Travis Head eyes good preparation in IPL for T20 World Cup
Article Text:
(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: Travis Head 's career graph saw a slight uptick in 2023, but the Australian batter is aware that maintaining that level will be difficult, and the forthcoming T20 World Cup will be his first stop on that trip.Head's hundreds in two of the biggest cricketing occasions last year - the WTC final and the 50-over World Cup summit clash - were Australia's guiding force against India.However, the 30-year-old now hopes that his time in the Indian Premier League would help him be at his best for the World Cup."I've come a long way as a player. I guess owning a little bit of the style I want to play and the way I have played overseas too, I've been able to tick a few boxes. Now, the pressure is to continue to play the way I am playing," Head told PTI in Bengaluru."I think in all formats, I need to make sure that I go back to what simplifies everything, which is my technique and my blueprint," he added.In the current IPL , Head demonstrated his ability to adjust while playing for Sunrisers Hyderabad As an opener, Head made 133 runs from five matches while striking at 177, giving SRH early momentum and also underscoring his readiness for a hectic T20 role for his country."With the World Cup coming around the corner and, hopefully, being involved in that squad and batting at the top of the order…it gives me good preparation here in the IPL to try and get some runs and have a little bit of form going into the World Cup," noted Head.But playing a full season of IPL could lead to burnout ahead of the ICC marquee event in June.Head was aware of it. "I think it is important for me to make sure that I'm mentally fresh throughout the IPL and continuing to work on my game, and making sure that I am ready for the World Cup when that time comes. But I am feeling like I am prepared and ready at the moment," he added.The confidence level inside Head was evident when he smashed a 24-ball 62 in his first IPL match in seven years.The South Australian said his increased game awareness helped him make an instant impact."It was nice to get some runs in the first game, and honestly, I didn't really have too many expectations.It's been a long time between IPLs for me, seven years, but I've learned a lot over that time and am a lot more mature now."I feel like I understand my game a lot more. So, a lot of different feelings coming back and not trying to be too nervous or worried about results. I am just making sure that the things that I've done over the last few years are going to work and I best prepare myself to play well for the franchise," he said.However, Head admitted that the presence of Pat Cummins (captain) and Daniel Vettori (head coach) in the SRH dressing room eased him into the new environment."Definitely having Pat and Dan, who I've worked closely with for Australia in the last few years, has helped me. It's a very relaxed environment."Soon as I got my contract, I knew that I had the backing from those guys and they've confidence in my game," he said.Head describes the World Cup final in Ahmedabad as the greatest highlight of his career. With a brilliant century of 120 balls, the left-hander led Australia to win by six wickets and their sixth ODI World Cup."I think the World Cup final was probably the biggest match of my career, regardless of whether I got runs or not. It was a huge moment. Obviously, I have not played in a World Cup before."So, to have all the stuff that happened, making it to a final and then being able to contribute in the final makes it all so much better," he explained.In addition to scoring a 90 at Ahmedabad and a few 40s at New Delhi and Indore during the 2023 Test series, Head said that this performance laid the groundwork for his resounding victory over India."The two finals come to mind. But a big Test series (2023) and some T20 games in between…I feel I drew a lot of my blueprint and confidence from that Test tour in India, which then flowed into the World Test Championship and then especially to the World Cup final."I was able to draw back on some of the things that worked well on those wickets and it's nice that it has come together in big games for me," Head offered.Head thought that his assured demeanor resonated perfectly in the Hyderabad team's changing room during the current IPL."We want to be aggressive and I think we've shown that in the first five games. It suited me as well. I feel, at the moment, we're being really aggressive in the right way and the right moments."Obviously, Power Play is very important for us and hopefully Abhi (Abhishek Sharma) and I can continue to do what we've been doing in the Power Play," he signed off.
Article Summary: Travis Head hopes his time in the Indian Premier League would help him be at his best for the World Cup. Head scored hundreds in two of the biggest cricketing occasions last year - the WTC final and the 50-over World Cup summit clash. The 30-year-old says the presence of Pat Cummins and Daniel Vettori in the SRH dressing room eased him into the new environment.

Article Title: New Zealand cricket team arrives in Islamabad for T20I series against Pakistan
Article Text:
(With inputs from ANI)

NEW DELHI: The New Zealand men's cricket team touched down in Islamabad on Sunday, gearing up for their highly anticipated five-match T20I series against Pakistan , set to commence on April 18.Pakistan Cricket took to social media platform X to extend a warm welcome to the New Zealand team, announcing their arrival in Islamabad ahead of the series.With the T20 World Cup looming on the horizon, both the Kiwis and the Men in Green are focused on fine-tuning their squads and evaluating players for the marquee event.In the midst of the ongoing Indian Premier League 2024, New Zealand have entrusted the leadership duties to experienced all-rounder Michael Bracewell for this tour. Bracewell, who has been sidelined due to injury concerns including a ruptured Achilles and a broken finger, returns to international cricket after a hiatus since March last year.On the other hand, Pakistan will be led by the prolific Babar Azam , who recently reclaimed the captaincy of the white ball format from Shaheen Afridi.The inclusion of star pacer Mohammad Amir and all-rounder Imad Wasim, who reversed their retirements, adds significant depth to Pakistan's squad for the series.
Article Summary: The New Zealand men's cricket team touched down in Islamabad on Sunday, gearing up for their highly anticipated five-match T20I series against Pakistan. Pakistan Cricket took to social media platform X to extend a warm welcome to the New Zealand team, announcing their arrival in Islamabad.

Article Title: Lionel Messi scores as record crowd witnesses Inter Miami's victory over Sporting Kansas City
Article Text:
(With inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: A staggering 72,610 fans packed Arrowhead Stadium to witness Inter Miami 's thrilling 3-2 victory over Sporting Kansas City . The match, which saw Lionel Messi shine, marked a significant milestone for the city's soccer scene.Lionel Messi, the main attraction behind the relocation of the match from Sporting's usual home stadium to Arrowhead, played a pivotal role in Miami's triumph.The global football icon showcased his brilliance with a goal and an assist, captivating the massive crowd with his performance.Miami took a 2-1 lead in the 51st minute when Messi unleashed a powerful strike from long range, finding the upper-right corner of the SKC net. However, Sporting quickly responded as Erik Thommy netted his second goal of the night in the 58th minute, leveling the score.The decisive moment arrived in the 71st minute when a mistake by Sporting KC allowed Miami's Diego Gomez to set up Luis Suarez for the winning goal, securing the victory for the visitors.Sporting had opened the scoring in the sixth minute through Thommy's clinical finish, but Miami swiftly equalized in the 18th minute courtesy of a well-taken goal by Gomez, set up by Messi.The match showcased moments of brilliance from both sides, with Messi coming close to adding to his tally with a threatening free-kick in the 41st minute. Sporting also had their chances, with Willy Agada testing Miami's goalkeeper Drake Callender.The record-breaking crowd at Arrowhead Stadium surpassed the previous attendance record set in 2010 when the then-Kansas City Wizards faced Manchester United in an exhibition match.
Article Summary: A staggering 72,610 fans packed Arrowhead Stadium to witness Inter Miami's thrilling 3-2 victory over Sporting Kansas City. The match, which saw Lionel Messi shine, marked a significant milestone for the city's soccer scene. Messi, the main attraction behind the relocation of the match from Sporting's usual home stadium to Arrowhead, played a pivotal role in Miami's triumph.

Article Title: La Liga round-up: Real Madrid clinch hard-fought win against Mallorca; Atletico Madrid thump Girona
Article Text:
(Inputs from AP)

NEW DELHI: Real Madrid clinched a hard-fought 1-0 win against Mallorca in the Spanish league on Saturday, resting key players ahead of their crucial Champions League game against Manchester City . Midfielder Aurélien Tchouaméni 's strike three minutes into the second half proved decisive, maintaining Madrid's commanding lead in the league.The victory on the Mediterranean island extended Madrid's lead in the league to 11 points, setting the stage for a crucial clash with Manchester City on Wednesday.Tchouaméni, who will miss the game in England due to suspension, emphasized Madrid's determination despite fatigue from their previous encounter with City."We have a very important game Wednesday," said Tchouaméni. "We played a very difficult game against City and we are tired, but we know that when we play for Madrid we have to give it our all until the end."Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti made strategic substitutions in the second half, with Vinicius Júnior and Eduardo Camavinga making crucial contributions. Dani Carvajal also joined the action in the final minutes, while key players like Rodrygo and Toni Kroos remained on the bench.Tchouaméni's long-range strike, which deflected off a defender, was the only breakthrough Madrid managed against a resilient Mallorca defense. Despite the victory, Madrid faces a tough test against Manchester City in the Champions League quarterfinal, followed by a pivotal La Liga clash against Barcelona.Ancelotti's milestone 183rd league game coached for Madrid draws him level with Zinedine Zidane, second only to Miguel Muñoz's record 424 league games.In another fixture, Atletico Madrid secured a vital 3-1 victory over Girona, with Antoine Griezmann scoring twice to boost their top-four aspirations. Atletico's victory places them in contention for Champions League qualification, while Girona's fourth-minute lead was short-lived as Atletico staged a remarkable comeback.With crucial Champions League fixtures on the horizon, both Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid will aim to maintain their momentum and secure their spots in European football 's elite competition next season.
Article Summary: Real Madrid beat Mallorca 1-0 to extend lead in Spanish league to 11 points. Aurélien Tchouaméni scored only goal of the game in the second half. Atletico Madrid beat Girona 3-1 to boost top-four aspirations.

Article Title: Bayern Munich secure 2-0 win in Bundesliga ahead of Champions League clash against Arsenal
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Bayern Munich emerged victorious with a 2-0 win over Cologne on Saturday, aiming to regain momentum ahead of their Champions League return leg against Arsenal. Despite recent league setbacks, Bayern showcased resilience, but suffered a major blow with winger Kingsley Coman sidelined due to injury.With Bayer Leverkusen poised to secure the Bundesliga title, Bayern's focus has shifted to the Champions League following their draw with Arsenal in the first leg.However, their hopes were dampened as Coman sustained an adductor muscle injury, ruling him out for several weeks.Bayern coach Thomas Tuchel expressed disappointment over Coman's injury, stating, "The injury of Kingsley is extremely bitter with him starting a game today after a very long time. It looked extremely painful... It's a big blow for us."Despite the setback, Bayern remains second in the Bundesliga with 63 points, with VfB Stuttgart joining them after a 3-0 win over Eintracht Frankfurt. Meanwhile, RB Leipzig secured a 3-0 victory over VfL Wolfsburg, maintaining fourth place ahead of Borussia Dortmund.In their match against Cologne, Bayern dominated from the start, creating numerous scoring opportunities in the first half. However, it was Raphael Guerreiro's superb curling shot in the 65th minute that broke the deadlock, putting Bayern ahead.A late save from goalkeeper Sven Ulreich preserved Bayern's lead before Thomas Mueller capitalized on a defensive error in stoppage time to seal the win.Despite the victory, Bayern's joy was tempered by Coman's injury setback. The club confirmed that the French winger would be sidelined for several weeks, dealing a blow to their Champions League aspirations.As Bayern prepare for their crucial clash with Arsenal, they will need to regroup and overcome the absence of Coman to keep their European dreams alive. With the Bundesliga title out of reach, Bayern's focus shifts entirely to their pursuit of Champions League glory.
Article Summary: Bayern Munich beat Cologne 2-0 in their Bundesliga clash on Saturday. Kingsley Coman sustained an adductor muscle injury, ruling him out for several weeks. Despite the setback, Bayern remains second in the Bundesliga with 63 points. VfB Stuttgart joined them after a 3-0 win over Eintracht Frankfurt.

Article Title: Joao Felix's bicycle kick seals narrow win for depleted Barcelona against Cadiz
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Joao Felix 's breathtaking bicycle kick propelled a depleted Barcelona to a hard-fought 1-0 victory over relegation-threatened Cadiz on Saturday.Barca manager Xavi Hernandez opted to rest key players ahead of their upcoming Champions League quarter-final against Paris Saint-Germain , a move that paid dividends as Felix's stunning strike secured three vital points.Barcelona now sit on 70 points, trailing leaders Real Madrid by eight points, setting the stage for an intense " El Clasico " showdown at the Santiago Bernabeu next weekend.Despite missing several regular starters, Barca showcased their depth and determination to secure a crucial win in the title race.The match saw Barcelona dominate the early proceedings, with Felix seizing the opportunity to showcase his exceptional talent. The Portuguese forward capitalized on a rebound from a corner in the 37th minute, executing a mesmerizing volley to break the deadlock and secure the win for his side.Reflecting on his sensational goal, Felix expressed his delight, stating, "I guess this stadium gives me luck. It wasn't planned, I just reacted and it happened. What a great feeling it was and even better with a win this time."Despite Cadiz's valiant efforts to salvage a point, Barcelona's resilient defense, led by goalkeeper Marc Andre ter Stegen, held firm. Ter Stegen's crucial saves frustrated Cadiz's attacking endeavors, preserving Barcelona's slender lead and securing their sixth consecutive victory in all competitions.With Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid also securing wins while resting key players, Xavi's decision to rotate the squad proved crucial in maintaining Barcelona's momentum. Despite missing star players such as Robert Lewandowski and Ilkay Gundogan, Barcelona's depth and determination shone through, extending their unbeaten run to 13 competitive matches.With crucial fixtures on the horizon, including the eagerly anticipated clash against PSG, Barcelona will look to build on this momentum and continue their pursuit of silverware on multiple fronts.
Article Summary: Joao Felix scores stunning bicycle kick as Barcelona beat Cadiz 1-0. Xavi rested key players ahead of Champions League quarter-final against PSG. Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid also secured wins while resting key players. Barcelona now sit on 70 points, trailing Real Madrid by eight points.

Article Title: Juventus' Serie A title hopes dashed in goalless stalemate against Torino
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Juventus' aspirations of clinching the Italian Serie A title were shattered after a disappointing 0-0 draw against city rivals Torino on Saturday. The draw leaves Juventus in third place in the standings with 63 points from 32 games, trailing league leaders Inter by a daunting 19 points.Once dominant in Italian football , Juventus clinched the Serie A title an astonishing nine times in a row from 2012 to 2020.However, the club has struggled to reclaim the trophy since then, facing stiff competition from their rivals.Speaking after the match, Juventus coach Massimiliano Allegri acknowledged the disappointment of not securing a victory but accepted the single point gained. "It's a point... we accept it," Allegri stated during a news conference. "There's always the disappointment of not having scored three, but if we hadn't lost (more) games we would have been in a better place. Today we take it, we have to improve things."Juventus' struggles away from home continued as they remained winless on the road since late January. Despite dominating possession and creating several opportunities, Juventus failed to find the back of the net against a resilient Torino side.The match saw Dusan Vlahovic squander two golden opportunities in the first half, with one effort striking the post and another testing Torino goalkeeper Vanja Milinkovic-Savic. Torino, meanwhile, thought they had taken the lead early in the second half, only for Duvan Zapata's goal to be disallowed for a foul in the buildup.As Torino pressed for a winner, Juventus goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny was called into action, making a crucial save to deny Antonio Sanabria's header. Despite a late scare when Szczesny required treatment after a collision, Juventus held on for the draw.The result ended Juventus' impressive streak of scoring away goals against Torino, highlighting the difficulties they faced in breaking down their resilient opponents.Looking ahead, Juventus face a challenging fixture against 14th-placed Cagliari before hosting second-placed AC Milan in their bid to salvage their season. Meanwhile, Torino, sitting in ninth place with 45 points, continue to impress defensively, boasting the most Serie A clean sheets at home this season with 11.
Article Summary: Juventus held to a 0-0 draw by city rivals Torino on Saturday. The draw leaves Juventus in third place in the Serie A standings. The result ends Juventus' impressive streak of scoring away goals against Torino. Juventus face a challenging fixture against 14th-placed Cagliari.

Article Title: ISL: NorthEast United hand Odisha FC humiliating 3-0 defeat
Article Text: KOLKATA: The stakes were higher for Odisha FC going into Saturday’s Indian Super League ( ISL ) clash in Guwahati. But in search of gaining some lost momentum going into the all-important playoffs, the Juggernauts suffered another rude jolt while hosts NorthEast United restored their pride in the last outing of the season with a clinical 3-0 win at Indira Gandhi Athletic Stadium .Parthib Gogoi, Nestor Albiach and Phalguni Singh scored one apiece inside the first 45 minutes to make it a memorable night for the Highlanders, who finished best among the ones finishing outside the top-six with playoff spots.Odisha, fighting for the League Shield only a couple of weeks ago, looked a shadow of their dominant self at the Highlanders’ home. Sergio Lobera , suspended for the match, could do nothing but look at his wards’ performance from the stands in disbelief. Resting some of their first-team players in the starting XI and taking the overseas trio of Roy Krishna , Ahmed Jahouh and Mortada Fall off at the half-time, the Kalinga Warriors were lacklustre throughout the 90 minutes to say the least.It looks like the long break due to the FIFA international window could not soothe their nerves following their AFC Cup Inter-zonal two-leg semifinal defeat to Central Coast Mariners about a month ago.In the 12th minute, Gogoi brought up a poacher’s goal from a fast counter-attack to give the hosts a deserving lead. The young Assamese striker placed his left-footed shot from centre of the box at bottom left corner following an assist by winger Jithin MS from left.Before the Kalinga Warriors could regroup, NorthEast doubled the lead four minutes later through Albiach’s clinical finish. Upon receiving a through from Gogoi outside the area, the Spanish attacking midfielder first forced centre-back Thoiba Moirangthem to be wrong footed near the centre of the box and then rounded off an onrushing Odisha goalkeeper Lalthuammawia Ralte before placing home a slow right-footed grounder near right post.Odisha, despite enjoying a larger share of possession, failed to convert that into meaningful forays into the opponents’ area. Their first real chance of reducing the margin went begging in the 25th minute when Krishna failed to convert from the spot. It was Krishna’s first penalty miss in ISL. The Fijian striker has converted from all his previous 10 spot kicks in the country’s top-tier league.Odisha winger Pranjal Bhumij had earned the penalty when he was brought down inside the box. But the former Bengaluru FC forward’s weak, low kick didn’t have enough power to beat NEUFC goalkeeper Mirshad Michu to his right.With nothing going in their favour on the night, the Juggernauts suffered another setback on the cusp of half-time when Phalguni wrote his name on the scoresheet three minutes into the first-half stoppage time.Phalguni was at the right place at the right time when Gogoi’s cross from right found him running at the centre of the box. With Odisha centre-back Fall towering over him, the diminutive Manipuri midfielder shook the net with his right-footed shot at the top right corner to send the Highlanders Brigade into a frenzy.
Article Summary: Parthib Gogoi, Nestor Albiach and Phalguni Singh scored one apiece inside the first 45 minutes to make it a memorable night for the Highlanders. Sergio Lobera could do nothing but look at his wards’ performance from the stands in disbelief.

Article Title: Manchester City hammer Luton 5-1 to move top of the Premier League
Article Text:
(With Reuters inputs)

Manchester City showcased their dominance in the Premier League with a commanding 5-1 victory over relegation-threatened Luton Town, propelling them to the top of the table in a fiercely contested title race.Erling Haaland continued his prolific goal-scoring form, notching his 20th league goal of the season to lead City to victory. Pep Guardiola 's side displayed their attacking prowess right from the start, with Jeremy Doku opening the scoring within 70 seconds after his shot deflected off Daiki Hashioka's face and into the net, setting the tone for City's relentless onslaught.Despite Luton Town's resilient defensive efforts, City's relentless pressure eventually paid off, with Mateo Kovacic finding the back of the net with a sublime strike from the edge of the box in the 64th minute.Haaland further extended City's lead with a well-converted penalty in the 76th minute, showcasing his clinical finishing ability once again. Although Ross Barkley managed to pull one back for Luton Town, City quickly reasserted their dominance, with Doku adding to the scoreline with a dazzling dribble and finish.Josko Gvardiol completed the rout for City with a goal seconds before the final whistle, sealing a comprehensive victory for Guardiola's men. With an impressive 73.7% possession and a staggering 37 shots on goal, City's dominance was evident throughout the match as they asserted their authority at the top of the Premier League table.As the title race heats up, City's convincing performance against Luton Town sends a strong message to their rivals, underlining their credentials as serious contenders for the Premier League title this season.With six games remaining, Guardiola's side will be determined to maintain their momentum and secure another league crown."Today was always going to be very difficult... I don't want to sound defeatist, but almost made peace with it at the beginning," Luton manager Rob Edwards said. "We stayed in the game as long as we could."I'm proud of the lads, they gave everything. No one likes losing 5-1, but (City) are a brilliant football team. They suffocated us. It was a long day for us today."Arsenal host Aston Villa on Sunday and Liverpool host Crystal Palace.City have no time to rest on their laurels as they host Real Madrid in the second leg of their Champions League quarter-final on Wednesday. The teams drew 3-3 in the opening leg. They then head to Wembley on Saturday for an FA Cup semi-final against Chelsea.
Article Summary: Manchester City beat Luton Town 5-1 to go top of the Premier League. Jeremy Doku, Mateo Kovacic, Erling Haaland and Josko Gvardiol scored for City. Pep Guardiola's side have six games remaining in the season. Arsenal host Aston Villa on Sunday and Liverpool host Crystal Palace.

Article Title: Delhi FC spoil ISL-bound Mohammedan Sporting’s I-League party
Article Text: KOLKATA: The stage was set long before the kick-off, with thousands donning black and white jerseys and waving club flags turning up and keeping the vast Salt Lake Stadium throbbing in anticipation on Saturday. Dignitaries had already filled up the VIP lounge.Delhi FC welcomed the newly-crowned I-League champions to the ground with a guard of honour.But in the end, the final match of the 2023-2024 season of I-League didn’t go the way the champions and the 40,000-odd home fans would have liked to, suffering a surprise 1-3 loss to Delhi FC.Goals from Alisher Kholmurodov (7), Gwgwmsar Goyary (31) and Sergio Barboza (90+8) queered the pitch for Mohammedan Sporting’s party at the stadium. Yet, when Mirjalol Kasimov scored in the ninth minute of the stoppage time in what became the final action of the season-ender, Mohammedan Sporting erupted in joy.It was not about the loss they would like to remember, but the team’s return to the big league was what embellished the sense of the occasion throughout the evening. It was about earning the promotion to the Indian Super League in their own right.No wonder that the noise was the loudest when Zodingliana Ralte, Samad Ali Mallick and Joseph Adjei — all of whom had led the side in the season — hopped on to the dais to receive the trophy fromAIFF president Kalyan Chaubey.That’s the prize the black-and-white brigade has been craving since they suffered the humiliation of relegation from the 2013-2014 season of I-League. A decade later, as they lifted the trophy, they would now be looking for bigger pastures.“We have finished one part of the journey today. We are about to begin another in the ISL with a bigger challenge and a bigger responsibility,” team manager Dipendu Biswas said.Mohammedan Sporting would be the third team from Kolkata to join the ISL bandwagon after Mohun Bagan SG and East Bengal FC.With the I-League title already sealed following the 1-2 win at Lajong FC a week earlier, Mohammedan Sporting’s Russian coach Andrey Chernyshov rested several of his first-team players on Saturday.But Delhi under former Mohammedan Sporting coach Yan Law turned out to be party poopers exposing the home team’s new-look defence to attacking in numbers and punished them with two quick goals.First, an unchallenged Kholmurodov headed in Pape Gassama’s corner and 18-year-old Goyary latched on to Bhupinder Singh’s through ball to beat goalkeeper Biaka Jongte, standing in place of regular Padam Chhetri, with consummate ease.Although Chernyshov introduced regulars like Beneston Barreto, David Hmar and Sheikh Faiaz after the break, the damage was already done and it was not enough to change the script.The upset result came hours after Real Kashmir suffered their biggest loss at home this term, going down 1-4 to Namdhari FC.Two Manipur teams — Neroca FC and TRAU — finished at the bottom two and were subsequently relegated.
Article Summary: Mohammedan Sporting suffer surprise 1-3 loss to Delhi FC. Goals from Alisher Kholmurodov (7), Gwgwmsar Goyary (31) and Sergio Barboza (90+8) queered the pitch for Mohammedan Sporting’s party.

Article Title: Newcastle hit Tottenham for four to enliven Champions League race
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

Newcastle United surged into the Premier League 's top six with a resounding 4-0 victory over Tottenham Hotspur, reigniting their outside hopes of securing a place in next season's Champions League . Alexander Isak starred with a brace as the Magpies delivered a dominant performance at St. James' Park.The result saw Spurs' lead over Newcastle reduced to 10 points with six games remaining, raising the possibility of a late charge by the Magpies, who have a more favorable run-in.Eddie Howe 's side faced defensive challenges due to injuries, prompting a switch to a back three formation. However, Tottenham struggled to capitalize on the home side's makeshift defense, with Newcastle largely untroubled after an early bright start by the visitors.The tide turned decisively in Newcastle's favor with two quickfire goals midway through the first half, both stemming from errors by Spurs' Micky van de Ven. Isak capitalized on these mistakes to open the scoring before Anthony Gordon doubled the lead moments later.Isak extended Newcastle's advantage early in the second half, further asserting his influence on the match. The Swedish striker's performance saw him move within striking distance of the Premier League's Golden Boot race, trailing Erling Haaland by just two goals.Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou responded to his side's lackluster display by making tactical substitutions, including withdrawing captain Son Heung-min. The visitors' woes were compounded by an injury to right-back Pedro Porro.The defeat dealt a blow to Tottenham's aspirations of securing a Champions League spot, particularly with the top-four race intensifying amid English clubs' struggles in European competitions. Spurs slipped behind Aston Villa on goal difference, with challenging fixtures against Arsenal, Liverpool, and Manchester City still to come.Postecoglou had warned of the toll of European football on squads, citing Newcastle's struggles as an example. Article Title: 'Not great', admits Novak Djokovic as 2024 slump continues
Article Text:
